data.name: Can you sort an array?
data.description:
# Task:
Your task in this kata is to decide if given unsorted array of integers (1 to N) can be sorted by moving elements by 2 positions in array. 

If element reaches end of the array, it will be moved to the beginning, e.g. {1, 2, 3, 4} after moving 4 will be transformed into {1, 2, 4, 3}, after moving 4 again, it will be {1, 4, 2, 3}. There is no limit of moves for each element.

# Input:
array of numbers

# Output:
true if array is solvable, false if it is not

# Examples:

`array {3, 1, 2, 6, 4, 5}` can be sorted if we move 6 and 3.

`array {1, 2, 3, 5, 4}` can not be sorted anyway.

There is how can you imagine this task:

![](http://i.imgur.com/XIHH4Vw.png)

There is an array `{5,2,3,6,1,4}` in the picture. After moving 5 and 4 the array will become sorted.

# Limits:
Size of an array will be always greater than 2 and will not exceed 3x10^6.
Return true if array is sortable, otherwise return false.

Optimal solution run all test cases in less then 4 secons.
